oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Avery Island Egrets: A success stay
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Radford, Elaine
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The egrets were doomed. Everyoneagreed on that. The new wealth createdby the conquest of America had, inturn, created a large middle class whosewomen demanded the finest fashions- including the lovely plumes of theegret to adorn their enormous collectionsof hats. Since the birds developedthe plumes only during the breedingseason, collecting the feathers meantkilling the adults and leaving eggs orchicks to die. Unable to reproduce, theegrets faced almost certain extinction.
